title: Jeremy Vine earns more than Samira Ahmed because he's more famous – but why should that be so?
text:
How familiar to you is the TV presenter Samira Ahmed? How about Jeremy Vine? Your answer may influence what you think about the fact that the former is taking the BBC to a tribunal over equal pay, and whether her actions in doing so are justified or not.

Ahmed, the presenter of BBC News’s Newswatch programme argues that her job is equivalent, or in her words “comparable” to that of Jeremy Vine when he was presenting BBC One’s Points of View – but whereas she was paid £440 per episode, he got up to £3,000 per show – a 600 per cent pay gap. Format, content and skills between the two programmes are almost exactly alike, says Ahmed, and so she wants £500,000 in back wages. She is being legally backed...
